author: Anshul Saxena
description: A traditional Italian-style Margherita pizza with a crispy thin crust, rich tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves — the pure essence of authentic Italian simplicity.
ingredients: 1/2 cup tomato sauce (preferably homemade or Italian-style)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix flour, yeast, sugar, and salt together.
Add warm water and olive oil, then knead into a smooth dough for 8–10 minutes.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 1–1.5 hours until it doubles in size.
Preheat the oven to 250°C (480°F) or as high as possible.
Punch down the dough, roll it out into a thin circle, and place it on a pizza tray.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the base, leaving the edges untouched.
Arrange mozzarella slices and fresh basil leaves on top.
Drizzle a little olive oil and sprinkle oregano if desired.
Bake for 7–10 minutes or until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbling.
Slice and serve hot — straight from the oven!
